alice.tuprologx.ide

Class LibraryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • alice.tuprologx.ide.LibraryManager

  • public final class LibraryManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A dynamic manager for tuProlog libraries.
    Version:
    1.1 - 27-may-05
    Author:
    Giulio Piancastelli

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Prolog engine
      The Prolog engine referenced by the Library Manager.
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> libraries
      Stores classnames for managed libraries.

      • setEngine

        public void setEngine(Prolog engine)
        Set the engine to be referenced by the library manager.
        Parameters:
        engine - The engine to be referenced by the library manager.

      • initialize

        void initialize()
        Initialize the repository for managed libraries using the standard libraries which come loaded with the tuProlog engine.

      • getEngine

        public Prolog getEngine()
        Get the engine referenced by the library manager.
        Returns:
        the engine referenced by the library manager.

      • isLibraryLoaded

        public boolean isLibraryLoaded(java.lang.String libraryClassname)
        Check if a library is loaded into the Prolog engine.
        Parameters:
        libraryClassname - The complete name of the library class to check.
        Returns:
        true if the library is loaded into the engine, false otherwise.

      • addLibrary

        public void addLibrary(java.lang.String libraryClassname)
                throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                       InvalidLibraryException
        Add a library to the manager.
        Parameters:
        libraryClassname - The name of the .class of the library to be added.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the library class cannot be found.
        InvalidLibraryException - if the library is not a valid tuProlog library.

      • removeLibrary

        public void removeLibrary(java.lang.String libraryClassname)
                   throws InvalidLibraryException
        Remove a library to the manager.
        Parameters:
        libraryClassname - The name of the .class of the library to be removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if the library class cannot be found.
        InvalidLibraryException - if the library is not a valid tuProlog library.

      • getLibraries

        public java.lang.Object[] getLibraries()
        Get the libraries managed by the library manager.
        Returns:
        The libraries managed by the library manager as an array of Objects.

      • loadLibrary

        public void loadLibrary(java.lang.String library)
                 throws InvalidLibraryException
        Load a library from the Library Manager into the engine.
        Parameters:
        library - The library to be loaded into the engine.
        Throws:
        InvalidLibraryException

      • unloadLibrary

        public void unloadLibrary(java.lang.String library)
                   throws InvalidLibraryException
        Unload a library from the Library Manager out of the engine.
        Parameters:
        library - The library to be unloaded out of the engine.
        Throws:
        InvalidLibraryException
        EngineRunningException

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String library)
        Check if a library is contained in the manager.
        Parameters:
        library - The name of the library we want to check the load status on.
